data.title: The Pussycat Dolls

data.text:
The Pussycat Dolls are a American girl group that started as a burlesque troupe back in 1995. Their shows included many celebrity guests including Gwen Stefani, who was their gateway of getting a record deal.

Carmit Bachar, who worked as a choreographer of No Doubt, whose frontwoman was Gwen, intruduced the idea of The Pussycat Dolls to Stefani and invited her to join them during one of the shows. Stefani loved the idea and decided to bring the board of the Interscope Records including Jimmy Iovine (the CEO of the company) & Ron Fair (future executive producer of The Dolls). Iovine loved the concept of The Dolls and decided to sign them as a recording artist. After re-casting process The Pussycat Dolls line up consisted of Carmit Bachar, Nicole Scherzinger, Melody Thornton, Ashely Roberts, Jessica Sutta & Kimberly Wyatt.

The group was active for 6 years - since 2004 'till 2010.

In 2008 Carmit Bachar annouced her decision of leaving the group.

On November 30 the group had reunited to perform at the finale of The X Factor: Celebrity and currently is preparing for their upcoming tour coming out Fall 2020. Original band member Carmit Bachar is present this time around, although one of the members decided not participating in the reunion, that being Melody Thornton.

Discography[]

Albums:

PCD (2005)

Doll Domination (2008)

Members[]

Carmit Bachar (1995 - March 8, 2008); (November 30, 2019 - present)

Ashley Roberts (2001 - February 27, 2010); (November 30, 2019 - present)

Jessica Sutta (June 2002 - January 29, 2010); (November 30, 2019 - present)

Kimberly Wyatt (June 2003 - February 26, 2010); (November 30, 2019 - present)

Nicole Scherzinger (May 2003 - August 2010); (November 30, 2019 - present)

Kaya Jones (May 2003 - early 2005)

Melody Thornton (June 2003 - early 2010)
